pageContext.claim: “You have other elections where they're indicting mailmen because the mailmen are stealing them and selling them. You have others where they're -- even the 2016, 1% are unaccounted for of the mail-in ballots.”
pageContext.analysis: A West Virginia postal carrier in July pleaded guilty to mail and election fraud after admitting he changed the political affiliation on five voter ballots from Democrat to Republican. The mail carrier said he did it “as a joke.” There is no evidence he or other mailmen in the state sold ballots.
